reviews.review_msg: Review for PHIL 322 - Michaela has a tendency to be abrasive. Quizzes/Tests about specific points in readings were not a constructive way to learn Philosophy. Deconstructed paper was not super helpful, and feedback was not delivered for the last couple submissions. Hard to correct details from the last submission without feedback.

Kept us late twice. The 'deconstructed paper' won't teach you anything if you've ever written a paper, and will teach you 1/2 of what you need if you haven't. Spoke disrespectfully to a guy who hadn't done an assignment on time and was asking about her late policy Told us she hadn't bothered to think of one, and never did. Not a bad lecturer.

Michaela is a very competent lecturer who made intrinsically dry and difficult content thought-provoking and inspiring. The classes were run very well, and she struck a good balance between lecturing and facilitating group discussion. She is a tough marker, but provides very valuable feedback. I would highly recommend her class.
